title.narrative: WASH OP 1 ACCESS TO SUSTAINABLE CLIMATE-RESILIENT Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2023, Communities in target rural areas, small towns and peri-urban areas have improved access to sustainable climate-resilient WASH services, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, Communities in target rural areas, small towns and peri-urban areas have improved access to sustainable climate-resilientWASH services

description.narrative: In 2021, with UNICEF Madagascar&39;s support, 76 municipalities were certified open defecation free (ODF). As a result, 1.1 million people, including 465,000 children, now live in ODF areas. Furthermore, 13,500 adolescent girls from 148 schools participated in UNICEF-supported menstrual hygiene management (MHM) activities at school. UNICEF also assisted 110,000 people (including 15,000 children under five years old) to access basic drinking water. UNICEF continued to work on sustainability issues, ensuring at least 75 per cent of the infrastructures constructed by UNICEF are climate-resilient and functional. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
